title.narrative: Ephyra® piloting innovative plug flow digestion in Canada

description.narrative: • Short general project overviewEphyra® is an innovative sludge digestion technology developed, proven and patented in the Netherlands by Royal HaskoningDHV Nederland B.V. (RHDHV). Its design and process control enable a sustainable and cost-efficient way to convert sludge from wastewater treatment plants (WWTP) into biogas. In collaboration with OCWA and with support of Partners for Water (PVW), RHDHV performed a study that showed the feasibility of a pilot project in the Great Toronto Area and upscaling potential within Canada (PVW4H19001). A pilot project is essential to gain the necessary certification and approval of the technology for application in the North American market, enhancing the market adoption and accelerating the commercial scale up. Technological and financial validation of the Ephyra® technology on North American sludge under different Canadian (weather) conditions is the key to market success. The consortium partners consider a pilot as the next step in their collaboration and are willing to invest in the realization and execution of the project.• Initial activities and results of the projectThe pilot project will answer the following questions:1. What is the amount of biogas production, TS and VS reduction with Ephyra® on NAS and circumstances?2. How do these numbers compare to conventional technologies used in Canada or a reference reactor?3. Does the Ephyra® installation perform according to model predictions and expectations?4. How stable is performance of Ephyra® and a reference reactor under normal operating conditions?5. How stable is performance of both installations under peak-loading conditions?The pilot will run in the Ephyra® configuration with two or three tanks placed in series. A reference situation will be used to compare pilot data to a conventional anaerobic digestion system.The project results/deliverables are:- 1 functional pilot installation design, based on the Ephyra® Technology Package (ETP);- 1 report on the pilot test results and recommendations for improvement;- 1 third party validation report;- 1 certificate for application of Ephyra® as a proven technology in the Canadian market;- 1 dissemination package (including scientific publications, presentations, etc.);- 2 updated business cases for full-scale implementation;- 1 agreement for full-scale implementation at a WWTP in Canada.• What makes the technology, product, method or approach used innovativeThe Ephyra® technology is unique compared to conventional systems in terms of capacity/yield, process/operation and applicability/costs. The plug flow regime and the separation of the different process of anaerobic digestion process is the key novelty. As a result Ephyra® can operate at short retention times (high capacities, smaller reactor volume and footprint, lower investment) and improves the digestion process (more biogas, less sludge disposal, lower operational costs). The plug flow regime including the typical internal recycling in Ephyra® is a newly patented technology.
